instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3209: What is 820-3209? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> run slowly
threads.message:
I found corrosion arround <TRANSISTOR>Q5530</TRANSISTOR>. I replaced this and checked it goes to <CAPACITOR>C5411</CAPACITOR> but still the same.

I measure on <CAPACITOR>C5411</CAPACITOR> and I have 3V and 0.5V in both pins. This is on the faulty board that run slowly.
On another full working board I have 0.5V in both pins. Any hack I can do? Any idea how to solve that?

Short <CAPACITOR>C5411</CAPACITOR> will solve the problem?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> run slowly
threads.message: Why not run ASD so you can see the exact failing sensor?? Could be another killed <TRANSISTOR>Q5530</TRANSISTOR>, corroded trace, dead <CHIP>U5410</CHIP>, no power to <CHIP>U5410</CHIP>, etc.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> run slowly
threads.message: ASD error: Motor is spinning slowly as it should

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> run slowly
threads.message: That is not an ASD error......

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> run slowly
threads.message:
<CHIP>U5410</CHIP> powered with 3.2V
I run ASD test yes and this is the error. No more errors. Any idea?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> run slowly
threads.message: "Motor is spinning slowly as it should". I have never had ASD tell me that. Picture please.
